PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Agfa Superpan Supreme safety film
CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 6, 1941, pg. 10, reads: "Glamorous Scenes as Society Turns Out To See "Aida" - Highlight of the National Association of Musicians' convention in Pittsburgh was the performance of the great opera, "Aida" by an entire Negro cast... Mr. and Mrs. Marr of Kansas City... - Photos by Harris and Lewis."
TitMainTitle: Man wearing light colored tuxedo, and possibly Elsa Elliott Harris (or Mr. and Mrs. Marr) standing in lobby of Syria Mosque for National Negro Opera Company performance of "Aida"
